  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHPX 211450 was found by an FRA inspector in the Belen, NM yard with multiple securement issues including an open vapor valve with a missing plug. The valve was secured and plug properly installed as well as securing the rest of the minor issues. No liquid release, just vapor. The car was released back into transportation.

item.title: Report X-2024090212
item.description:
Report X-2024090212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-31
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This is an undeclared hazmat. The box has no markings on it. The box contains a 1X12oz bottle of Purell Advanced Refreshing Gel. The SDS shows the Purell as regulated. The box was found because a bottle of non regulated glass cleaner had a loose cap and leaked. The glass cleaner soiled all items in the box. The Purell did not leak.

item.title: Report E-2024090007
item.description:
Report E-2024090007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: UPPER SANDSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3267 Sika FerroGard 903 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below. The pail was crushed as a result of stacking. The impacted area was cleaned with pads and granular absorbents. The damaged pail and all cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XJP notified ERTS of a damaged 400 pound drum of UN1807 Phosphorus Pentoxide that was just picked up from a customer. XPO personnel noticed the drum had a small puncture at the bottom upon arrival. The drum lost a small amount of material, but the spill did not happen at their terminal or in the trailer, per XPO, and they confirmed the drum was not actively leaking. ERTS dispatched contractors to assist with overpacking, however XPO terminal personnel overpacked the damaged drum. The drum was held at XPO's terminal pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024090215
item.description:
Report X-2024090215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FRA Hazmat Inspector John Powell identified GATX 286323 with residue on exterior of car during an inspection at the BNSF Terminal in Spokane, WA on 8/26/2024. The source appeared to come from the man way area and all man way swing bolts were inspected and found to be tool tight. Upon arrival to the BNSF Railway Pasco, WA Terminal the car was then identified again by BNSF Mechanical who were aware of the prior inspection and removed the man way lid to inspect the gasket. The gasket was identified as an insert gasket on the man way lid but was also identified as deteriorated due to no longer having the compression to allow a complete seal on the nozzle. BNSF Mechanical HM Responders removed the gasket and replaced with a man way nozzle gasket to allow continued movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090011
item.description:
Report E-2024090011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, at 0740 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of Techno Adhesive #199. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 110 gallons of Techno Adhesive #199 (UN1593, Adhesive, Dichloromethane (mixture), 6.1, III) from (2) 55-gallon DM’s. The release was caused by a forklift puncture and impacted 20ft x 8ft area of the trailer floor and a 20ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the tanker. Contractors placed the 2 damaged drums into overpacks and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF’s and (2) 95-gallon DF overpacks then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024090013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN1814 Cal Clean 947 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor. The crew advised the release occurred due to the valve being open. The valve was closed and tightened, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would be no further release. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. All waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090017
item.description:
Report E-2024090017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 27, 2024, at 1806 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Hamilton, Ohio regarding the release of Houghto-Etch AX-2040. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of Houghto-Etch AX-2040 (UN2817, Ammonium Hydrogendiflouride Solution, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 2ft x 1ft area of concrete. The damaged drum was placed in an 85-gallon DF overpack, absorbents and neutralizer were then used to clean the release. All waste was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, and (1) 85-gallon DF overpack then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090169
item.description:
Report X-2024090169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK APPLIED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPPING PAPERS, MARKS OR LABELS. DURING THE DOWNGRADE AND RETURN TO SHIPPER PROCESS THE CONTENTS WERE DISCOVERED LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, WE DISCOVERED THREE GALLON CANS OF SPECPOXY 1000 PARTS A AND B INSIDE THE BOX. TWO OF THE CANS CONTAIN SPECPOXY 1000 PART A WHICH ARE NON-REGULATED. THE THIRD CAN CONTAINS SPECPOXY 1000 PART B WHICH IS REGULATED AS UN2735, AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. ALL THREE CANS WERE LEAKING DUE LOOSE LIDS. ADDITIONALLY, THE CANS ARE DENTED.

item.title: Report E-2024090010
item.description:
Report E-2024090010

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN1760 "CL5789" from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 quarts of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged jug was placed into a 20-gallon poly drum. Absorbents and vinegar solution were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted concrete. All impacted absorbents and pallet pieces were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024090090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: car was reported releasing vapor with an audible hiss and odor. Code 3 arrived and determined that the PRD was releasing. The pressure was 160 psi and 17" of outage. Since the car was in outbound, and VOC readings were detected at ground level, a midland kit was applied and the car moved to an isolated track. The shipper was contacted to dispatch a repair company. SRS was contacted by the shipper. It was determined that this was the fist load since being requalified at the shop. The car was monitored until it could be transferred, then cleaned and purged. After cleaning the PRD was sent to a facility to be tested and determined that it was set to operate at 159 psi. Car is in hold waiting an OTMA

item.title: Report X-2024090135
item.description:
Report X-2024090135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/23/2024 at approximately 1400, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5007286 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 1 fiberboard box that contained 3 plastic containers labeled as "Muriatic Acid". Dangerous Goods Administration obtained an online safety data sheet, which classified the commodity as UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid. Two of the three containers leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the requred markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The spillage also compromised the integrity of the shipping label and the outer package; however, the inner contents are being held, pending an FAA investigation. The shipment contained the identical contents as were reported in Spill Incident #20260. This shipper has been placed on embargo list.

THE OUTER PACKAGING DID NOT HAVE ANY LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. RMP WAS NOTIFIED AND CONTACTED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.description:
Report X-2024090071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: EDGERTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE HAZMAT WITH ALL PPE WHICH INCLUDED BOOTS, GOOGLES, SILVER INNER LINER SHEILDS, GLOVES, APRON, AND SLEEVES. THEN PREFORMED AN INVESTIGATION TO ENSURE THE PROPER WAY TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. THEN FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE WHICH LED TO PH TAPE IT AND THEN USED SODIUM BICARBITIN TO NUETRILLIZE THE CHEMICAL. THEN THE DECISION TREE HAD RESPONDER PUT IT ON CART WITH SPILL TRAY WITH LINER, ESURING TO USE PLASTIC DUSTPAN AND BROOM, AFTER IT WAS ALL DONE AND THE SODIUM BICARBIN WAS ACTIVATED, RESPONDER FINISHED CLEANING UP THE SPILL.

item.title: Report E-2024090058
item.description:
Report E-2024090058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: EDEN PRAIRIE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a roadside release of UN1139 SRW Low Gloss X-Treme from (5) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor. Approximately 10 ounces of product impacted the trailers undercarriage and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below. The pails were crushed due to improper securement of the pallet and load shift. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents and pads which were containerized along with impacted debris into a 55- gallon metal drum. The damaged pails were containerized into a 55-gallon metal and 15-gallon poly drums. The waste was transported to XPO Logistics terminal located in Eagan, MN for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 22, 2024, one (1) 2-gallon jug of UN3149 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Upon arrival, the crew discovered that terminal personnel had already deployed soda ash to the spill. MSES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3149-impacted dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On August 22, 2o24, two (2) boxes containing five (5) 1-gallon jugs of UN3149 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the truck floor and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN3149-impacted dock floor and box truck. All impacted material was collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/21/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 317901 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting spillage from undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 3 - 1 gallon plastic containers packaging inside of a fiberboard box. Each plastic container contained muriatic acid. The shipment was discovered to a have spilled from the closure of each of the plastic containers. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging and paparwork. The shipment has been place in a salvage drum and is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. Upon release by the FAA, the shipment will be sent for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XNJ experienced a UN1789 Transchem Muriatic Acid release from multiple boxes each containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-oiunces of product released to the pallet of cardboard boxes on the dock only. The release was suspected to occur due to heat and expansion of the material in the bottles as the caps on the jugs were leaking. The impacted cardboard and faulty jugs were collected into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090027
item.description:
Report E-2024090027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 29th at 0900et it was discovered that 4 containers on rail car GIMX516137 was leaking document numbers 018679127FLE, 018679125FLE, 018679126FLE, and 018679124FLE. The team on sight called for an response team to come address the release. The response team showed up and contained and put down absorbent to clean up the release. There was approximately 5gallons of material that was released and collected and added back to the containers. It was determined that 2 of the roll of containers were damaged and the material needed to be transferred into new containers. There was special equipment needed to accomplish this so everything was contained and the equipment arrived on July 30th and the material was transferred to the new containers. There was more absorbent material added to the container to solidify any liquid and was then monitored for 24hrs. On July 31st the cleanup was complete and the containers were ready for shipment.

The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door 36. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the packaging and pallet and estimated that three (3) cups of material was released due to heat causing the material to expand. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify the damage. The impacted product and cardboard was placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

  • Description: On August 20, 2024, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN1490 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. A neutralizer agent and granular absorbents were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail and all impacted material were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drums for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report X-2024081722
item.description:
Report X-2024081722

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08-12-2024 a CN transportation employee smelled a strong chemical odor emanating from tank car #TAEX 1856 while working. in the Kirk Yard in Gary, IN. The CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified and responded to the area to investigate. An assessment of tank car # TAEX 1856 (Residue/UN 1136/Class 3) revealed a vapor release from the pressure relief device which was detected audibly and by the use of a combustible gas detector along with a leak detecting solution. A pressure test was performed via the vapor valve which revealed the tank car to have an internal pressure of 5 psi. The low pressure indicated the pressure relief device was faulty and not performing as intended, allowing vapors to escape. The tank car was moved to an isolation track where the remaining internal pressure was vented through a scrubbing media which stopped the leak. The pressure relief device was then removed and replaced with a blind flange to prevent further leakage. The shipper of record was notified via Chemtrec that the car would require repair and re-qualification by a certified tank car repair facility prior to being released for continued transportation.

item.title: Report X-2024081948
item.description:
Report X-2024081948

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3800
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/27/2024, the BNSF Los Angeles hub personnel reported Unit ESTU 500350 (Waybill Hazardous) as leaking a substance from the middle of the container that did reach the ground after unit de ramped from a train. Unit was taken to the Hazmat Pit for safety. On the behalf of the shipper, approved contractor United Pumping was contacted and dispatched to complete inspection. Interior inspection revealed palatized cases, palletized gallon drums and 2 IBC Totes of Sulfuric Acid in 2 rows, stacked 2 high in the nose throughout the container. Source of the leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes in the middle of the unit. The cause for the Leak was determined to be 2 IBC Totes appeared to have a pre existing creases near the top that caused the totes plastic to break, creating package failure contributing to the material leak. Total quantity of leaked liquid was approximately 10 gallons of product, 5 gallons from each IBC Tote.

  • Description: 1. X-2024081821 Sort manager brought package over to the QA dept due to the closures being open and discovered two packages labeled as a class 2 dangerous goods non-flammable gas were inside the package. The outer packaging gave no indication there were two inner items with UN 3164 Articles, Pressurized, Pneumatic item. It appears this is an undeclared hazmat. No spill or damage to the items is observed. 2. X-2024081822 Sort manager brought package over to the QA dept due to the closures being open and discovered two packages labeled as a class 2 dangerous goods non-flammable gas were inside the package. The outer packaging gave no indication there were two inner items with UN 3164 Articles, Pressurized, Pneumatic item. It appears this is an undeclared hazmat. No spill or damage to the items is observed.

  • Description: Unmarked box found leaking on delivery truck during AM sort. Box removed from vehicle and inspected. Inner box found to have Class 8 diamond and UN2794 markings with Pb battery. Due to no directional arrows or hazmat markings on the outer box, package had been transported on conveyor system and loaded sideways causing battery to spill. Packing slip on side of outer box only lists item as Battery Start 12V

  • City: ANCHORAGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPS DELIVERED A REGULATED DG PACKAGE TO ALASKA AIRLINES ON 8/19/24 FOR TRANSPORT TO NOME, ALASKA. ALASKA AIRLINES RETURNED THE PACKAGE TO UPS ON 8/20/24 BECAUSE THEY OBSERVED WETNESS ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS BY A UPS DESIGNATED RESPONDER DISCOVERED (3) 1 LITER BOTTLES OF ALCOHOL.(1) BOTTLE HAD LEAKED DUE TO THE CAP LOOSENING DURING TRANSIT. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED WITHOUT CUSHIONING OR CONTAINMENT MATERIALS. THE TAPE/SHRINK WRAP SEALING THE SCREW ON CAPS HAD FAILED TO KEEP ONE OF THE CAPS TIGHT IN TRANSIT.

item.description:
Report I-2024080107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: Anchorage
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: TOTE MARITIME ALASKA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 18, 2024, TAG inspected trailer V 007244, booking SEA 1049003. This load sailed NB on the Midnight Sun Voyage 24129 that departed Tacoma on 8/14/2024. Upon inspecting it, TAG found undeclared hazardous items of 3 boxes of UN0012 Cartridges for Weapons, Inert Projectile and 4 boxes of UN0012 visible labeled limited quantity marked Cartridges for weapons both items are Class 1.4S explosives. There were other hazardous products in the trailer that were a Class 4.1 Flammable Solid which creates an incompatibility with the 1.4S explosives. The trailer was placarded as 4.1 and should have been placarded as Class 1.4S and segregated from the 4.1 product. Once discovered an updated Manifest was requested and trailer placarded correctly.

  • Description: On August 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrochloric acid was punctured by a skid and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the hydrochloric acid-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 15, 2024. four (4) 1-gallon containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel collected four (4) damaged 1-gallon containers of paint and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon container

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Railroad employee observed fresh liquid on the exterior of UTLX 662597 while switching the track. Car was isolated and a response contractor was called to investigate and repair the car. Contractor mounted the car and observed the manway nozzle gasket protruding unusually from the seat of the manway lid. Contractor opened the manway and noted the nozzle gasket was deteriorated and misaligned on the nozzle causing the release. A new nozzle gasket was installed and the manway was properly secured.

  • Description: 1. X-2024081755 Shipment was on hold due to hazmat labels that were on shipment, a DGD had not been presented. Had not been screened yet. Opened the box and performed physical search to find a can of flammable sealer. Screened the rest of the shipment and performed physical search on the other two boxes as well. Found another can of flammable sealer and two aerosols on the box with hazmat symbol on it. Undeclared hazmat found: 3 Cans of KILZ Original all Weather Sealer and Severe Stain blocker -Flammable Liquid and Vapor, 1 gallon each 2 Aerosol Cans of KILZ Upshot Interior Primer Overhead Stain Sealer - Extremely Flammable Liquid and Vapor, 10 ounces each 2. X-2024081756 Shipment was on hold due to hazmat labels that were on shipment, a DGD had not been presented. Had not been screened yet. Opened the box and performed physical search to find a can of flammable sealer. Screened the rest of the shipment and performed physical search on the other two boxes as well. item.description:
Report I-2024080074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0925hrs on July 17, 2024, Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) Railroad's Hazmat Department received notice of a possible hazmat leak in its East St. Louis Yard. Hazmat mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders identified PROX 32954 (residue ANHYDROUS AMMONIA car) as the source of the leak. The vapor valve was found slightly opened, and the vapor valve's secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Responders closed the valve and secured the plug. Air monitoring confirmed the leak to be mitigated. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best Information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

  • Description: On 07/15/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL 165 (AMS-MSP), a passenger's vape pen was observed to be smoking. Water was applied to the device and was placed in a fire containment bag. The smoke from the vape pen was mitigated. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No flight crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FM were notified.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 45000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver failed to slow down for a clover leaf curve resulting in the unit rolling over onto the driver side. Single vehicle crash. During the roll over event, dirt built up inside the crash box, breaking the piping from the crows foot. Product start escaping the tank through the broken pipe inside the crash box due to the way the unit came to rest.
